generif.text: DNMT3L stimulates de novo methylation by Dnmt3a.
The carboxyl-terminal half of DNMT3L was found to be responsible for the stimulation of the DNA methylation activity of Dnmt3a and Dnmt3b.
Regulates germ cell-specific gene expression and intracisternal A-particle suppression, which are critical for male germ cell proliferation and meiosis.
Dnmt3L-Dnmt3b interactions play an important role in the regulation of DNA methylation during mammalian development.
The acquisition of DNMT3L by a common ancestor of eutherians and marsupials might have been closely related to the evolution of imprinting.

Data show that binding of DNMT3L to DNMT3A2 promotes reorganization of DNMT3A2 subunits and leads to formation of specific complexes with enhanced DNA methyltransferase activity and increased S-adenosyl-L-methionine binding.
Crystallographic studies of human DNMT3L showed that the protein has a carboxy-terminal methyltransferase-like domain and an N-terminal cysteine-rich domain

the carboxy-terminal domain of human Dnmt3L interacts with the catalytic domain of Dnmt3a, demonstrating that Dnmt3L has dual functions of binding the unmethylated histone tail and activating DNA methyltransferase
Importance of DNA methylation profile at DNMT3L promoter not only as a promising biomarker for cervical cancer but also provides insight into the possible role of DNMT3L in cancer development.
Observational study and meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
DNMT3L(R271Q) is impaired in its ability to stimulate de novo DNA methylation by DNMT3A.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Overexpression of DNMT3L, which functions by regulating the activity of DNMT3A and DNMT3B, increased cellular proliferation and anchorage-independent growth.
CG dinucleotide recognized by the Dnmt3a and Dnmt3L complex are distinctive at retroelements and imprinted domains.
DNMT3L exerts a major effect on the transcriptional regulation of a specific target gene, such as thymine DNA glycosylase
DNMT3L is a novel marker and is essential for the growth of human embryonal carcinoma.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Processive methylation is enhanced 3-fold in the presence of DNMT3L, an inactive homolog of DNMT3A, therefore providing a mechanism for the previously described DNMT3L activation of DNMT3A.
We have identified loss of methylation at the DNMT3L promoter in ocular surface squamous neoplasia cases.
This study offers insights into the manner by which DNA methylation patterns are deposited and reveals a new level of interplay between members of the de novo DNMT family.
mutation analysis of SYCP3, DNMT3L and MSH4 in patients with maturation arrest of spermatogenesis and couples with recurrent miscarriages.
SNP rs2070565, as well as haplotypes AAA and GAA, may be associated with male infertility; DNMT3L may contribute to azoospermia susceptibility in humans
Genetic polymorphisms of DNMT3L involved in hypermethylation of chromosomal ends are associated with greater risk of developing ovarian endometriosis.

DNMT3L is one of the key players in de novo DNA methylation of imprinting control elements and retrotransposons, which occurs after genome-wide epigenetic erasure during germ cell development. (Review)
CpG island encompassing the promoter and first exon of human DNMT3L gene is a PcG/TrX response element
DNMT3L rs2070565 (genotype P = 0.007, allele P = 0.0026) confers an increased risk of developing schizophrenia at an early age in individuals with family history.
DNMT3L can address DNMT3A/B to specific sites by directly interacting with TFs that do not directly interact with DNMT3A/B
crystal structures of DNMT3A-DNMT3L (autoinhibitory form) and DNMT3A-DNMT3L-H3 (active form) complexes at 3.82 and 2.90 A resolution, respectively
the present study has demonstrated that variations in the DNMT3L gene do not contribute to stage I-II endometriosis-associated infertility.
DNMT3L overexpression is associated with Down syndrome.
Nutrition and its DNA methylation influence cognitive decline.
EGR1 interacts with DNMT3L to inhibit the transcription of miR-195 and plays an anti-apoptotic role in the development of gastric cancer.
Decoding the Genetic Alterations in Genes of DNMT Family (DNA Methyl-Transferase) and their Association with Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
Stable DNMT3L overexpression in SH-SY5Y neurons recreates a facet of the genome-wide Down syndrome DNA methylation signature.
DNMT3L inhibits hepatocellular carcinoma progression through DNA methylation of CDO1: insights from big data to basic research.

BP.term: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

MF.term: DNA (cytosine-5-)-methyltransferase activity, acting on CpG substrates

name: DNA methyltransferase 3 like

reactome.name: Regulation of endogenous retroelements by Piwi-interacting RNAs (piRNAs)

summary: CpG methylation is an epigenetic modification that is important for embryonic development, imprinting, and X-chromosome inactivation. Studies in mice have demonstrated that DNA methylation is required for mammalian development. This gene encodes a nuclear protein with similarity to DNA methyltransferases, but is not thought to function as a DNA methyltransferase as it does not contain the amino acid residues necessary for methyltransferase activity. However, it does stimulate de novo methylation by DNA cytosine methyltransferase 3 alpha and is thought to be required for the establishment of maternal genomic imprints. This protein also mediates transcriptional repression through interaction with histone deacetylase 1. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2012].
